sentences.english: That won't stop us from blathering on about it, of course.
sentences.chinese: 當然，這並不能阻止我們在這個問題上喋喋不休。

sentences.english: Mosquito bites can be prevented by spraying the body with a chemical containing DEET.
sentences.chinese: 蚊蟲叮咬，可阻止含有避蚊胺噴灑化學物質的身體。

sentences.english: Well, shouldn't you try to stop them from making this big mistake?
sentences.chinese: 嗯，那你該不該試着阻止他們闖下大禍？

sentences.english: This time, however, Chinese authorities in Hebei Province stepped forward and stopped the deal.
sentences.chinese: 但這一次，河北省的地方政府插手並阻止了這一交易。

sentences.english: The policeman stopped the thief from stealing money in the shop.
sentences.chinese: 警察阻止小偷從商店裏偷錢。

sentences.english: We must stop him from giving himself up.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須阻止他投案自首。

sentences.english: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.
sentences.chinese: 你是廢棄敬畏的意，在神面前阻止敬虔的心。

sentences.english: It's also meant to withstand an explosion from inside.
sentences.chinese: 也意味着從裏向外阻止爆炸。

sentences.english: Bounty hunters trying to stop her from reaching Five Elements Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 玉疆殺手想阻止我去五指山。

sentences.english: Some officers lashed out with batons and shields, but their superiors restrained them.
sentences.chinese: 一些警察揮動着警棍和盾牌，但被他們的上級阻止了。

sentences.english: I'm sure a writer… for two years.
sentences.chinese: 我確信什麼也無法阻止李蕾成爲一名作家。

sentences.english: Doing so would help prevent the sample from becoming unnecessarily moist.
sentences.chinese: 這樣做會有助於阻止樣品不必要的受潮。

sentences.english: Cao Zheng waiting to militia, stop von instructor Zhang Bingfei trial.
sentences.chinese: 曹政等人前往民兵連，阻止馮指導員審訊張秉飛。

sentences.english: We had to stuff the ventilator shafts up to stop the smoke entering the room.
sentences.chinese: 爲了阻止煙進入室內，我們只好把通風道堵起來。

sentences.english: Bassanio tried to keep Antonio from accepting these terms.
sentences.chinese: 巴薩尼奧設法阻止安東尼奧接受條件。

sentences.english: In other words, ageing is not only stoppable but also reversible.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說就是衰老不僅可以阻止，而且可以逆轉。

definition: to curb/to put a stop to/to stop/to check/to limit
to defer/to postpone/to put off/to retard/to slow sth down
to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
to check/to contain/to hold back/to keep within limits/to constrain/to restrain
